summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message about new beginnings from Pastor Travis Hearn! Pastor Travis delivered a powerful sermon about the true meaning of Christmas and the transformative power of Jesus Christ. The message centered on how Jesus offers us a completely fresh start - not just a seasonal celebration, but a life-changing opportunity to be born again. PT reminded us that Jesus wasn't just born to be a historical figure, but to provide humanity a way to be completely renewed. He powerfully explained that we're all sinners in need of a savior, and Jesus is that ultimate gift of grace. The sermon wasn't just about religious ritual, but about developing a genuine relationship with God. Pastor Travis challenged everyone to move forward, forget what's behind, and embrace the new creation Christ offers. One of the most touching moments was when he invited people to surrender their lives to Jesus, with over a hundred people raising their hands to receive salvation! Can you imagine the spiritual transformation happening in that moment? This wasn't just a sermon - it was an invitation to a completely new life.
mainPoints: Jesus was born to provide a new beginning
Salvation starts with confessing and believing
Becoming a Christian means having a new mission

versesMentioned.text: Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past. See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way in the wilderness and streams in the wasteland.
Today in the town of David a Savior has been born to you; he is the Messiah, the Lord.
She will give birth to a son, and you are to give him the name Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins.
For all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God.
For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.
Repent, then, and turn to God, so that your sins may be wiped out, that times of refreshing may come from the Lord.
As a dog returns to its vomit, so fools repeat their folly.
As far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our transgressions from us.
You will again have compassion on us; you will tread our sins underfoot and hurl all our iniquities into the depths of the sea.
Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!
For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.
But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead, I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.
However, I consider my life worth nothing to me; my only aim is to finish the race and complete the task the Lord Jesus has given me—the task of testifying to the good news of God's grace.
Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you.
So that you may become blameless and pure, 'children of God without fault in a warped and crooked generation.' Then you will shine among them like stars in the sky.

You are the light of the world. A town built on a hill cannot be hidden. Neither do people light a lamp and put it under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, and it gives light to everyone in the house. In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.

Monday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 5:17: 'Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!'
Monday.focus: Embracing a fresh start with Christ
Monday.action: Write down three areas of your life where you need a 'new beginning'. Pray over each one, asking God to transform and renew those spaces.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me release my past and embrace the new life You've designed for me. Show me where I need Your transformative power most. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Philippians 3:13: 'But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead'
Tuesday.focus: Moving forward without dwelling on past mistakes
Tuesday.action: Identify one past hurt or mistake you've been holding onto. Symbolically 'release' it by writing it down and then destroying the paper as an act of letting go.
Tuesday.prayer: God, give me the strength to move forward. Help me not be defined by my past, but by Your future for me. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Romans 6:23: 'For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.'
Wednesday.action: Reflect on a time when someone showed you undeserved kindness. How does this help you understand God's grace?
Wednesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, thank You for Your incredible grace. Help me understand and appreciate the gift of Your salvation more deeply. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Acts 3:19: 'Repent, then, and turn to God, so that your sins may be wiped out, that times of refreshing may come from the Lord.'
Thursday.action: Identify one area of your life where you need to make a genuine change. Create a specific plan to move away from that behavior.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, reveal the areas where I need to turn away from old habits. Give me strength and courage to change. Amen.

Friday.scripture: 1 John 1:9: 'If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.'
Friday.action: Spend time journaling about areas where you struggle with feeling forgiven. Remind yourself of God's promise of complete cleansing.
Friday.prayer: God, help me fully receive Your forgiveness. Remove any lingering shame or guilt. Thank You for Your perfect love. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Psalm 103:12: 'As far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our transgressions from us.'
Saturday.focus: God's radical grace and new beginnings
Saturday.action: Reach out to someone you've struggled to forgive, or who might need to know about God's transformative love.
Saturday.prayer: Father, use me as an instrument of Your grace. Help me extend the same mercy to others that You've shown me. Amen.
